resources.string: Take Photo
Retake Photo
Take a photo of the result
Take a photo of the measured result on the device
Enter the measured value
Press briefly (*sd_on_off*) to turn device on.
Take a photo of the screen with the measurement and fill in the measurement value.
Press and hold (*sd_on_off*) (3 sec.) to turn the instrument off.
Rinse the sensor with distilled water (never touch the electrode with anything) and place the protective cap back. Make sure the protective cap is filled with KCL solution.
Connect the turbidity tubes and fill the tube with the water sample until you cannot see the black circle at the yellow bottom anymore.
Empty the tube with small intervals until you can see the black circle at the yellow bottom again.
Read out the turbidity on the side of the tube.
Fill in the obtained turbidity value in the app.
Empty the tube completely, clean if necessary, disconnect tubes and store them.
Rinse the sensor with distilled water (never touch the electrode with anything) and place the protective cap back.
Open the lid of the tester.
Rinse the compartments with the water sample.
Fill the three compartments until the edge with the water sample. Avoid touching the water sample or the inside of the tester.
Compare the sample colour with the intervals for pH and free chlorine to find the best match.
Select the colour intervals that best match your sample.
In the next screen, tap both colour intervals that best match your sample as shown in the example below.
Clean the compartments with distilled water.
Add the Phenol Red tablet reagent directly from the foil into the left compartment (pH Phenol Red). Avoid touching the reagent tablets.
Add the DPD No.1 tablet directly from the foil into the right (Cl DPD) compartment. Avoid touching the reagent tablets.
Close the box with the lid and shake until the reagents are dissolved. Be sure to place the lid correctly with the arrow facing you.
Select colour intervals
Color intervals
Select the colour intervals before continuing
The Checkit Comparator uses two cells and a coloured disc.
Insert the coloured disc in the comparator.
Add one %reagent1 tablet to the other cell, and close it with a lid. Swirl the cell until the reagent is completely dissolved
Add one %reagent1 powder pack to the other cell, and close it with a lid. Swirl the cell until the reagent is completely dissolved
By rotating the disc, match the two colours against daylight, looking AWAY from the sun.
Rinse the vial with the water sample.
Fill the Nitrate Test Tube to the 20 ml mark.
Add one level spoon full %reagent1 Powder and a %reagent2 Tablet to the Test Tube. Don\'t crush the tablet!
Close it with a lid and shake for 1 minute.
Allow 1 minute for the flocculation of the NITRATE-Test Powder.
Invert the Test Tube two or three times to complete the flocculation.
Allow 2 minutes time for complete sediment of NITRATE-Test Powder.
Fill one cell to the 10 ml mark with the clear solution of the Test Tube.
Fill one cell to the 10 ml mark. Fill the other cell with deionized water to the 10ml mark.
Pipet 2 ml %reagent1 Reagent Solution to each cell. Close the cells with lids and swirl gently.
Add one %reagent1 tablet to the other cell and crush the tablet.
Afterwards add one %reagent2 tablet, crush the tablet and close it with a lid. Swirl the cell until the reagent is completely dissolved.
take the cell from the right-hand compartment of the comparator and remover the lid.
Add one %reagent2 tablet to the cell in the right-hand space of the comparator, close it with a lid. Swirl the cell until reagent is completely dissolved.
In the case of high levels of zinc:
Add one EDTA tablet to the already coloured water sample.
Crush and mix to dissolve the tablet. Then continue with the next step of the instructions.
Add one %reagent1 in each cell. Close cells with a lid and swirl gently.
Add 15 drops of %reagent2 to each cell. Close cells with a lid and swirl gently.
Add 21 drops of %reagent3 to each cell. Close cells with a lid and swirl gently.
Remove the lids. Place the cell with the sample facing the mark (point) in the right-hand compartment of the comparator.
Place the reference cell facing the mark (point) in the left-hand compartment of the comparator.
Hold the comparator at an angle so that enough north daylight goes through the cell. The mirror unit makes use of the view through the entire length of the cell.
It is essential to rinse the cells thoroughly after each test.
Store CHECKITÂ® Disc in the dark.
Round off test
Note: pH values below 4 produce always a red colouration. pH values above 10 produce always a purple colouration.
Fill one cell to the 10 ml mark with the water sample.
Fill both cells to the 10 ml mark with the water sample.
Fill the other cell with deionized water to the 10ml mark.
Close the cell with a lid and place it facing the mark (point) in the left-hand space of the comparator. It acts as a blank.
Close one cell with a lid and place it facing the mark (point) in the left-hand space of the comparator. It acts as a blank.
Place the cell with the water sample facing the mark (point) in the left-hand space of the comparator.
Place the cell with the deionized water facing the mark (point) in the right-hand space of the comparator.
Place this cell facing the mark (point) in the right-hand space of the comparator.
Place the second cell facing the mark (point) in the right-hand space of the comparator.
Remove protective cap, rinse the electrode with distilled water.
Immerse the instrument into the sample so that the instrument is submersed to the sealing ring level. Stir the sensor gently while it is in the sample.
Press briefly (*sd_on_off*) to freeze / unfreeze the measurement.
Note: Regularly check the calibration of the device and recalibrate if necessary. For calibration instructions: see the product manual in the box.
Remove protective cap, rinse the sensor with the water sample.
Immerse the instrument into the sample so that the instrument is submersed to the sealing ring level. Press briefly (*sd_on_off*) to freeze / unfreeze the measurement.
Wait %reactionTime1 for complete colour reaction.
Wait %reactionTime2 for complete colour reaction.
Wait %reactionTime3 for complete colour reaction.
Add one %reagent1 tablet in the other cell. Crush the tablet and close it with a lid. Swirl the cell until reagent is completely dissolved.
Add one %reagent3 Tablet to this cell, crush it and mix it with a clean stirring rod. Close it with the lid.
In the case of high levels of copper:
First measure the result (A). Then add one EDTA tablet to the already coloured water sample.
Crush and mix to dissolve the tablet. Read the second result (B). The concentration Zinc is the first result (A) minus the second result (B).

"Make sure that:
 - 4 AA batteries are inserted in the battery compartment
 - The SD card is inserted in the device
 - The oxygen sensor is recently calibrated (see manual for calibration)"
Connect the sensor connecting plug to the jack on the measuring device and tighten it clockwise.
Turn the device on.
Immerse the sensor in the water sample. Make sure that the temperature sensor is fully immersed. Wait until the result is stable to ensure the dissolved oxygen is fully diffused.
In order to remove the sensor from the device, the connecting plug is unscrewed anticlockwise and the plug is pulled out of the jack.
Be careful with the sensor since it is sensitive. The sensor must always be kept moist. For this purpose, the storage flask included in the scope of supply is fitted on the sensor and screwed tight.
In the next screen, enter the measured value from the display (the red square shows the location where the result will be displayed).
Take a photo of the result on the display.
